RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV., J
~ CrLM.C. No. 4365 of 2016
Dated 1* August, 2016
ORDER

1.The petitioner is the 3 accused in C.C.No.255 of 2016 on
the files of the Judicial Magistrate of 1* Class I, Palakkad.
He faces allegations for having committed offences
punishable under Section 420 read with Section 34 of the
IPC.

2.This is a split up case from C.C.No.14 of 2008 in which the
petitioner was arrayed as 4" accused. The case was
proceeded with and as per judgment dated 19.3.2016,
accused 2 and 5 were acquitted under Section 248(1) of
the Code of Criminal Procedure (hereinafter referred to as
the “Code”).

3.The learned counsel submits that coercive steps are
pending against the petitioner and prays that necessary
directions be given to the learned Magistrate to consider
his application for recall of warrant and grant of bail.

Ease
wae 1
isaare
2016/KER/33663
Crl.M.C. No. 4365 of 2016 -2-
4.Heard the learned Public Prosecutor as well.
5.It is for the petitioner to approach the court below and
appraise the reasons for his absence and to seek for
recalling the warrant and grant of Bail. There is no reason
for this Court to assume that the learned Magistrate will
not exercise his discretion judicially and in accordance
with law.
6.In the result, the petitioner is directed to surrender before
the learned Magistrate within 2 weeks from the date of
this order and prefer application for recall of warrant and
also for grant of bail with advance notice to the prosecutor
concerned. In that event the learned Magistrate is directed
to consider and dispose of the said application, preferably
on the same day itself, on its merits and in accordance
with law.
Petition is disposed off as above.
Sd/-
RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV.,
JUDGE
